wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Gray (28 September 1852 –12 April 1940) was an English academic, Master of Jesus College, Cambridge from 1912 until his death.Gray was educated at Blackheath Proprietary School and Jesus College, Cambridge. He was Fellow of Jesus from 1875 to 1885; Junior Proctor from 1885 to 1886; and Senior Tutor and Vice-Master from 1895 to 1912. Gray published several ghost stories in the style of the "antiquarian ghost stories" of M. R. James under the pseudonym "Ingulphus" which were collected in 1919 in Tedious Brief Tales of Granta and Gramarye.
